item.title: Error in client.java in my client not server!
item.dc:creator: @barrage_time barrage time
item.description:
@barrage_time wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:2, topic:166137”]Errrrr. You changed an Object to a primitive.
p is a String.
Simple fix; change 43594, to “43594”. (With the quotation marks).[/quote]
Well tyvm mate helped me TYVM
rep++ tbh
^^^o lol sorry i couldnt i need 15 rep myself to do that

item.source: Error in client.java in my client not server!

item.title: Error in client.java in my client not server!
item.dc:creator: @barrage_time barrage time
item.description:
@barrage_time wrote:

I have an error, the error is not in my server it is on my client, i edited the client.java from

public static void setserver(String s, String p ) { server = "0.0.0.0"; port = p; }

to

public static void setserver(String s, String p) { server = "0.0.0.0"; port = 43594; }

And now i get this error:

client.java:2494: incompatible types found : int required: java.lang.String port = 43594; ^ Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic
item.source: Error in client.java in my client not server!
